title: Augmented Reality-Based Mathematics Teaching-Learning Design and Assessment

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and experience in using digital tools
context.additional_context: A course enhancing instructional design capabilities for mathematics education using augmented reality content in a smartphone-centric limited technological environment. Validates practical classroom applicability through project-based assessments.

learning_goals: Participants can create a design document for visualizing math concepts using augmented reality tools.
Participants can provide peer feedback on AR math learning scenarios using the EVAR assessment rubric.
Participants can produce low-cost AR math educational content executable in smartphone environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
